children.value:
Couper offers three attributes to manipulate the request header fields. The header
attributes can be defined unordered within the configuration file but will be
executed ordered as follows:
list of request header to be removed from the upstream request.
Key/value(s) pairs to set request header in the upstream request.
Key/value(s) pairs to add request header to the upstream request.

Couper offers three attributes to manipulate the response header fields. The header
attributes can be defined unordered within the configuration file but will be
executed ordered as follows:
list of response header to be removed from the client response.
Key/value(s) pairs to set response header in the client response.
Key/value(s) pairs to add response header to the client response.

attribute allows to modify the HTTP status code to the
given value.
HTTP status code to be set to the client response.
If the HTTP status code ist set to

, the response body and the HTTP header
field
is removed from the client response, and a warning is logged.

Couper offers three attributes to manipulate the query parameter. The query
attributes can be defined unordered within the configuration file but will be
executed ordered as follows:
list of query parameters to be removed from the upstream request URL.
Key/value(s) pairs to set query parameters in the upstream request URL.
Key/value(s) pairs to add query parameters to the upstream request URL.

Couper offers three attributes to manipulate the form parameter. The form
attributes can be defined unordered within the configuration file but will be
executed ordered as follows:
list of form parameters to be removed from the upstream request body.
Key/value(s) pairs to set form parameters in the upstream request body.
Key/value(s) pairs to add form parameters to the upstream request body.

Couper offers three attributes to manipulate the form parameter. The form
attributes can be defined unordered within the configuration file but will be
executed ordered as follows:
list of form parameters to be removed from the upstream request body.
Key/value(s) pairs to set form parameters in the upstream request body.
Key/value(s) pairs to add form parameters to the upstream request body.
